p: We also found structural changes between both species and a higher aliphatic index (thus higher thermostability) for S. torgalensis in the predicted GBP1 protein, which is induced by interferons and has antiviral activity [ 59, 60]. The structural differences were mostly located in the GTP-binding domain of the protein, which hydrolyzes GTP to GDP, and is crucial for the function of the protein in antiviral defense [ 61].
